main event: A UFO sighting of silver objects including one isosceles triangle observed near Victoria, Texas on December 16, 1957.
interesting points: The observed triangle could be covered by a golf ball held at arm's length., The objects were described as tricolored and capable of speeds comparable to a 500 series jet., The sighting lasted for approximately 6 minutes and involved visual ground observation., There were possibly illusions of speed due to aircraft effects and atmospheric conditions., The conclusion suggested it could be a balloon or possibly an aircraft.
sighted object: silver isosceles triangle and tricolored high-speed objects
witness description: employee of Southern Pacific Railroad with Air Force Reserve experience as an aircraft observer
